alert.note: Alert for Comanche (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:08PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Comanche County through 745 PM CDT... At 708 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Coldwater, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Coldwater around 715 PM CDT. Lake Coldwater around 720 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Wilmore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
